page.title: 02MEETHILL TOWER
page.content: The Meethill school badge has a picture of {Meethill Tower }on it. The tower is south west from the town . The tower was built by local Liberals to mark the Parliamentary reform of the early 1830s. It was originally fitted up as an observatory but was never properly completed.When the foundations were built,they found a stone crypt.Inside was an urn which contained the remains of a human jaw-bone with a few teeth and part of a thigh-bone. There are a few true stories connected with Meethill Tower. Once a schoolboy was killed while playing at the tower. Another story is about a prisoner who escaped from nearby Invernettie Prison and used the tower as a hide-out for 2 days, before being recaptured.
